
## Method 1 - Regression

We ran a linear model of the Home Sales data estimate `SALES-PRICE` based on all the other variables other than `ID`.

```{r}
#| message: false
#| echo: false
library(tidyverse)
```

You can see the structure of the data in the model as follows:

```{r}
#| message: false
#| echo: false
homes <- read_csv("./Data/HOME_SALES.csv")
glimpse(homes)
```

```{r}
#| label: run-linear-model
lm_out <- lm(SALES_PRICE ~ . -ID, data = homes)
summary(lm_out)
```

Check the residual plots in @fig-resid-plots

- With [subcaptions](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/figures.html#subcaptions).

```{r}
#| label: fig-resid-plots
#| layout-ncol: 2
#| fig-cap: "Residual Plots from the Linear Model"
#| fig-subcap:
#|   - "Residuals vs FItted"
#|   - "QQ Plot"
#|   - "Scale-Location"
#|   - "Residuals vs Leverage"

plot(lm_out)
```
